DataElement.preferredName: Substance Administration Intervention or Procedure Reuse Template Study Activity Name Code Change Text ISO21090.ST.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An activity defined at a global library level that is an action of applying, introducing or otherwise giving medications or other substances to a subject or experimental unit. EXAMPLE(S): Administration of methotrexate as part of chemotherapy. A character string that is a revision of the original text of the procedure to enable the coding of the text. EXAMPLE(S): If the original text is "message", the name code modified text could be set to "massage", so that the text can be successfully coded. NOTE(S): In the context of BRIDG, text modification occurs a single time for a given instance of original text.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Substance Administration Intervention or Procedure Reuse Template Study Activity Name Code Change Text
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A material with particular features.:The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective._The words or language units by which a thing is known.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.:The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.:The words of something written.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Substance Administration Intervention or Procedure Reuse Template Study Activity
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A material with particular features.:The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective.

Concepts.definition: Any matter of defined composition that has discrete existence, whose origin may be biological, mineral or chemical.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.:The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.:The words of something written.

Concepts.definition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Character string datatype stands for text data.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
